name: Avoid uncontrolled import into the current symbol table (PHP)
description:
This metric uses Psalm data-flow engine to detect a call path where input data from the user is sent into the current symbol table without prior sanitization.

A violation is raised when user input is passed to function extract() with an overwritting flag. A violation is also raised when function import_request_variable() is called with no prefix or an empty prefix.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: The software constructs all or part of the current symbol table via user-controllable inputs. These inputs are not neutralized or are incorrectly neutralized. As a consequence, some applications may work with an unexpected behavior.
reference:
CWE-914: Improper Control of Dynamically-Identified Variables
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/914.html

PHP Manual - Function Reference - Warning - Do not use extract() on untrusted data
https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.extract.php
remediation: Explicitly list all the symbols you want to import in the current symbol table. When calling function extract(), use a non-overwritting flag.
remediationSample:
<?php

// Remediation sample #1

$foo = $_GET["foo"];
$bar = $_GET["bar"];


// Remediation sample #2

extract($_GET, EXTR_SKIP);
alternativeName: Avoid uncontrolled import into the current symbol table (PHP)
